t: 1 Chronicles 1
Historical Records From Adam to Abraham
To Noah’s Sons
Adam,*p Seth, Enosh,
Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.
The*pln sons of Noah: Shem,*ld Ham and Japheth.
The Japhethites
The*ln sons of Japheth: Gomer,*ld Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
The*ln sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz,*ld Riphath and Togarmah.
The*ln sons of Javan: Elishah,*ld Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
The Hamites
The*ln sons of Ham: Cush,*ld Egypt, Put and Canaan.
The*ln sons of Cush: Seba,*ld Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteka. The*ln sons of Raamah: Sheba*ld and Dedan.
Cush*ln was the father of Nimrod,*ld who became a mighty warrior on earth.
Egypt*ln was the father of the*ld Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
Canaan*ln was the father of Sidon*ld his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
The Semites
The*ln sons of Shem: Elam,*ld Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram. The*ln sons of Aram: Uz,*ld Hul, Gether and Meshek.
Arphaxad*ln was the father of Shelah, and*ld Shelah the father of Eber.
Two*ln sons were born to Eber: One*ld was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
Joktan*ln was the father of Almodad,*ld Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
Shem,*pld Arphaxad, Shelah,
Eber,*ld Peleg, Reu,
Serug,*ld Nahor, Terah
and*ld Abram (that is, Abraham).
The Family of Abraham
The*ln sons of Abraham: Isaac*ld and Ishmael.
Descendants of Hagar
These*ln were their descendants: Nebaioth*ld the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
Descendants of Keturah
The*ln sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran,*ld Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. The*ln sons of Jokshan: Sheba*ld and Dedan.
The*ln sons of Midian: Ephah,*ld Epher, Hanok, Abida and Eldaah. All*ln these were descendants of Keturah.
Descendants of Sarah
Abraham*ln was the father of Isaac. The*ln sons of Isaac: Esau*ld and Israel.
Esau’s Sons
The*ln sons of Esau: Eliphaz,*ld Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
The*ln sons of Eliphaz: Teman,*ld Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz; by*ld Timna: Amalek.
The*ln sons of Reuel: Nahath,*ld Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
The People of Seir in Edom
The*ln sons of Seir: Lotan,*ld Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
The*ln sons of Lotan: Hori*ld and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
The*ln sons of Shobal: Alvan,*ld Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam. The*ln sons of Zibeon: Aiah*ld and Anah.
The*ln son of Anah: Dishon.*ld The*ln sons of Dishon: Hemdan,*ld Eshban, Ithran and Keran.
The*ln sons of Ezer: Bilhan,*ld Zaavan and Akan. The*ln sons of Dishan: Uz*ld and Aran.
The Rulers of Edom
These*ln were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned: Bela*ld son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.
When*ld Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
When*ld Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
When*ld Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith.
When*ld Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king.
When*ld Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king.
When*ld Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Akbor succeeded him as king.
When*ld Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab.
Hadad also died. The*pln chiefs of Edom were: Timna,*ld Alvah, Jetheth,
Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
Magdiel and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
1 Chronicles 2
Israel’s Sons
These*ln were the sons of Israel: Reuben,*ld Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
Judah
To Hezron’s Sons

The*ln sons of Judah: Er,*ld Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the Lord’s*s sight; so the Lord*s put him to death.
Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar bore Perez and Zerah to Judah. He had five sons in all.
The*pln sons of Perez: Hezron*ld and Hamul.
The*ln sons of Zerah: Zimri,*ld Ethan, Heman, Kalkol and Darda —five in all.
The*ln son of Karmi: Achar,*ld who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things.
The*ln son of Ethan: Azariah.*ld
The*ln sons born to Hezron were: Jerahmeel,*ld Ram and Caleb.
From Ram Son of Hezron
Ram*ln was the father of Amminadab,*ld and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah.
Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,
Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.
Jesse*ln was the father of Eliab*ld his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,
the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,
the sixth Ozem and the seventh David.
Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel.
Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
Caleb Son of Hezron
Caleb*ln son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.
When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel.
Later,*ln Hezron, when he was sixty years old, married the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead. He made love to her, and she bore him Segub.
Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead.
(But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements—sixty towns.) All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.
After*pln Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
Jerahmeel Son of Hezron
The*ln sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram*ld his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
The*ln sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz,*ld Jamin and Eker.
The*ln sons of Onam: Shammai*ld and Jada. The*ln sons of Shammai: Nadab*ld and Abishur.
Abishur’s*ln wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
The*ln sons of Nadab: Seled*ld and Appaim. Seled died without children.
The*ln son of Appaim: Ishi,*ld who was the father of Sheshan. Sheshan*ld was the father of Ahlai.
The*ln sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether*ld and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
The*ln sons of Jonathan: Peleth*ld and Zaza. These*ln were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
Sheshan*ln had no sons—only daughters. He*ld had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
Attai*ln was the father of Nathan, Nathan*ld the father of Zabad,
Zabad*ld the father of Ephlal, Ephlal*ld the father of Obed,
Obed*ld the father of Jehu, Jehu*ld the father of Azariah,
Azariah*ld the father of Helez, Helez*ld the father of Eleasah,
Eleasah*ld the father of Sismai, Sismai*ld the father of Shallum,
Shallum*ld the father of Jekamiah, and*ld Jekamiah the father of Elishama.
The Clans of Caleb
The*ln sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha*ld his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.
The*ln sons of Hebron: Korah,*ld Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.
Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
Caleb’s*ln concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
The*ln sons of Jahdai: Regem,*ld Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.
Caleb’s*ln concubine Maakah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Makbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Aksah.
These were the descendants of Caleb. The*pln sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal*ld the father of Kiriath Jearim,
Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
The*ln descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were: Haroeh,*ld half the Manahathites,
and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
The*ln descendants of Salma: Bethlehem,*ld the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the Rekabites.
1 Chronicles 3
The Sons of David
These*ln were the sons of David born to him in Hebron: The*ld firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel; the*ld second, Daniel the son of Abigail of Carmel;
the*ld third, Absalom the son of Maakah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the*ld fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
the*ld fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital; and*ld the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
These*ld six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. David*p reigned in Jerusalem thirty-three years,
and these were the children born to him there: Shammua,*ld Shobab, Nathan and Solomon. These four were by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.
There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,
Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet—nine in all.
All these were the sons of David, besides his sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
The Kings of Judah
Solomon’s*ln son was Rehoboam, Abijah*ld his son, Asa*ld his son, Jehoshaphat*ld his son,
Jehoram*ld his son, Ahaziah*ld his son, Joash*ld his son,
Amaziah*ld his son, Azariah*ld his son, Jotham*ld his son,
Ahaz*ld his son, Hezekiah*ld his son, Manasseh*ld his son,
Amon*ld his son, Josiah*ld his son.
The*ln sons of Josiah: Johanan*ld the firstborn, Jehoiakim*ld the second son, Zedekiah*ld the third, Shallum*ld the fourth.
The*ln successors of Jehoiakim: Jehoiachin*ld his son, and*ld Zedekiah.
The Royal Line After the Exile
The*ln descendants of Jehoiachin the captive: Shealtiel*ld his son,
Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.
The*ln sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel*ld and Shimei. The*ln sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam*ld and Hananiah. Shelomith*ld was their sister.
There*ld were also five others: Hashubah,*ld Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-Hesed.
The*ln descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah*ld and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah and of Shekaniah.
The*ln descendants of Shekaniah: Shemaiah*ld and his sons: Hattush,*ld Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat—six in all.
The*ln sons of Neariah: Elioenai,*ld Hizkiah and Azrikam—three in all.
The*ln sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah,*ld Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani—seven in all.
1 Chronicles 4
Other Clans of Judah
The*ln descendants of Judah: Perez,*ld Hezron, Karmi, Hur and Shobal.
Reaiah*ln son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
These*ln were the sons of Etam: Jezreel,*ld Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.
Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These*ln were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem.
Ashhur*ln the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
Naarah*ln bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.
The*ln sons of Helah: Zereth,*ld Zohar, Ethnan,
and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
Jabez*p was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, “I gave birth to him in pain.”

Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, “Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.” And God granted his request.
Kelub,*pln Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Rekah.
The*pln sons of Kenaz: Othniel*ld and Seraiah. The*ln sons of Othniel: Hathath*ld and Meonothai.
Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah*ln was the father of Joab, the*ld father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were skilled workers.
The*ln sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru,*ld Elah and Naam. The*ln son of Elah: Kenaz.*ld
The*ln sons of Jehallelel: Ziph,*ld Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
The*ln sons of Ezrah: Jether,*ld Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered’s wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

(His wife from the tribe of Judah gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the children of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married.
The*ln sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham: the*ld father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maakathite.
The*ln sons of Shimon: Amnon,*ld Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon. The*ln descendants of Ishi: Zoheth*ld and Ben-Zoheth.
The*ln sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er*ld the father of Lekah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,
Jokim, the men of Kozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (These records are from ancient times.)
They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.
Simeon
The*ln descendants of Simeon: Nemuel,*ld Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;
Shallum*ld was Shaul’s son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son.
The*ln descendants of Mishma: Hammuel*ld his son, Zakkur his son and Shimei his son.
Shimei*p had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah.
They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.
Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan—five towns—
and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
Meshobab,*pln Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
The*p men listed above by name were leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,
and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks.
They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly.

The*p men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir.
They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
1 Chronicles 5
Reuben

The*p sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,
and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph)—
the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanok,*ln Pallu, Hezron and Karmi.
The*ln descendants of Joel: Shemaiah*ld his son, Gog his son, Shimei*ld his son,
Micah his son, Reaiah*ld his son, Baal his son,
and*ld Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.
Their*ln relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records: Jeiel*ld the chief, Zechariah,
and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.
To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in Gilead.
During*ld Saul’s reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead.
Gad
The*ln Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salekah:
Joel*ld was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.
Their*ln relatives, by families, were: Michael,*ld Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia and Eber—seven in all.
These*ld were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
Ahi*ld son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.
The*ln Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as they extended.
All*p these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.

The*p Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service—able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle.
They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.

They were helped in fighting them, and God delivered the Hagrites and all their allies into their hands, because they cried out to him during the battle. He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him.
They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand people captive,
and many others fell slain, because the battle was God’s. And they occupied the land until the exile.
The Half-Tribe of Manasseh
The*p people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon).
These*p were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families.
But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
1 Chronicles 6
Levi
The*ln sons of Levi: Gershon,*ld Kohath and Merari.
The*ln sons of Kohath: Amram,*ld Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
The*ln children of Amram: Aaron,*ld Moses and Miriam. The*ln sons of Aaron: Nadab,*ld Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Eleazar*ld was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas*ld the father of Abishua,
Abishua*ld the father of Bukki, Bukki*ld the father of Uzzi,
Uzzi*ld the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah*ld the father of Meraioth,
Meraioth*ld the father of Amariah, Amariah*ld the father of Ahitub,
Ahitub*ld the father of Zadok, Zadok*ld the father of Ahimaaz,
Ahimaaz*ld the father of Azariah, Azariah*ld the father of Johanan,
Johanan*ld the father of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem),
Azariah*ld the father of Amariah, Amariah*ld the father of Ahitub,
Ahitub*ld the father of Zadok, Zadok*ld the father of Shallum,
Shallum*ld the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah*ld the father of Azariah,
Azariah*ld the father of Seraiah, and*ld Seraiah the father of Jozadak.
Jozadak*ld was deported when the Lord*s sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
The*pln sons of Levi: Gershon,*ld Kohath and Merari.
These*ln are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni*ld and Shimei.
The*ln sons of Kohath: Amram,*ld Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
The*ln sons of Merari: Mahli*ld and Mushi. These*ln are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:
Of*ln Gershon: Libni*ld his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah*ld his son,
Joah his son, Iddo*ld his son, Zerah his son and*ld Jeatherai his son.
The*ln descendants of Kohath: Amminadab*ld his son, Korah his son, Assir*ld his son,
Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph*ld his son, Assir his son,
Tahath*ld his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah*ld his son and Shaul his son.
The*ln descendants of Elkanah: Amasai,*ld Ahimoth,
Elkanah*ld his son, Zophai his son, Nahath*ld his son,
Eliab his son, Jeroham*ld his son, Elkanah his son and*ld Samuel his son.
The*ln sons of Samuel: Joel*ld the firstborn and*ld Abijah the second son.
The*ln descendants of Merari: Mahli,*ld Libni his son, Shimei*ld his son, Uzzah his son,
Shimea*ld his son, Haggiah his son and*ld Asaiah his son.
The Temple Musicians
These*p are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the Lord*s after the ark came to rest there.

They ministered with music before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the Lord*s in Jerusalem. They performed their duties according to the regulations laid down for them.
Here*p are the men who served, together with their sons: From*ln the Kohathites: Heman,*ld the musician, the*ld son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
the*ld son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the*ld son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
the*ld son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the*ld son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
the*ld son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the*ld son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
the*ld son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the*ld son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
the*ld son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the*ld son of Levi, the son of Israel;
and*ln Heman’s associate Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph*ld son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
the*ld son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the*ld son of Malkijah,
the son of Ethni, the*ld son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
the*ld son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the*ld son of Shimei,
the son of Jahath, the*ld son of Gershon, the son of Levi;
and*ln from their associates, the Merarites, at his left hand: Ethan*ld son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the*ld son of Malluk,
the son of Hashabiah, the*ld son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
the*ld son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the*ld son of Shemer,
the son of Mahli, the*ld son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the*ld son of Levi.
Their*p fellow Levites were assigned to all the other duties of the tabernacle, the house of God.

But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense in connection with all that was done in the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel, in accordance with all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
These*pln were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar*ld his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua*ld his son,
Bukki his son, Uzzi*ld his son, Zerahiah his son,
Meraioth*ld his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub*ld his son,
Zadok his son and*ld Ahimaaz his son.
These*p were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):
They*ln were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasturelands.
But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
So*ln the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,
Hilen, Debir,
Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands.
